perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees, for a period of three years after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS may choose to file reports pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. Availability of public information under Rule 145(d) is not guaranteed.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the explicit obligation for PSS to file reports, which is crucial for the affiliate to be able to sell shares under Rule 145(d) of the Securities Exchange Act. By making this discretionary, the contract weakens the affiliate's ability to utilize Rule 145(d) for transferring shares, creating a potential violation of securities laws if the affiliate is unduly restricted from selling their shares due to PSS not providing required information.

perturbation.original_text: In addition, if the provisions of Rules 144 and 145 are amended to eliminate restrictions applicable to the PSS Common Stock received by the undersigned pursuant to the Merger, or at the expiration of the restrictive period set forth in Rule 145(d), PSS, upon the request of the undersigned, will cause the certificates representing the shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned in connection with the Merger to be reissued free of any legend relating to the restrictions set forth in Rules 144 and 145(d) upon receipt by PSS of an opinion of its counsel to the effect that such legend may be removed.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that Rules 144 and 145 are amended to eliminate restrictions, PSS may consider reissuing certificates without restrictive legends at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the obligation for PSS to reissue certificates without restrictive legends when amendments to Rules 144 and 145 eliminate restrictions, or upon expiration of the Rule 145(d) restrictive period. By making the reissuance discretionary, the contract potentially hinders the affiliate's ability to freely transfer shares even when legally permissible, introducing a violation of securities regulations related to the transfer of securities.
